description:
Unattached persons

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
Unattached persons are single, married but separated,
divorced and widowed persons who live without a cohabiting
partner and without never-married children in a one-person
or multi-person household. They may share the household with
only non-family persons (non-relatives), for example,
sharing a flat with students or with an acquainted married
couple. Also, they may live in a household together with
related household members (not lineally related, or
laterally related), such as uncle, aunt, brother, sister,
cousin. The marital status of the unattached person is
irrelevant here. Unattached persons living in one-person
households are referred to as persons living alone.
